column2: This is where the elite infantry serving a Jewish ruler is trained. Special care is taken to equip the soldiers with the finest heavy armor that money can buy. This, combined with rigorous training and iron discipline, makes them an elite force to be truly feared.
column3: C’est là que l’infanterie d’élite au service d’un seigneur juif s’entraîne. Une attention spéciale est donnée pour équiper les soldats avec les meilleures armures lourdes qui puissent être achetées. Cela, combiné avec l’entraînement rigoureux et une discipline de fer, font de ces soldats une terrifiante force d’élite.
column6: Aquí es donde se entrena la infantería de élite que sirve a los señores judios. Se pone especial atención en equipar a los soldados con la mejor armadura que el dinero pueda comprar. Combinado esto con el entrenamiento riguroso y la disciplina férrea, hacen que estas fuerzas de élite sean realmente temidas.

column2: The “Campus Martius” (or field of mars) is where military training for legionaries is carried out. Traditionally the training consisted of using training weapons that were much heavier than the actual weapon. The recruits place a stake in the training field and attack it as if it were an enemy. Commoners will generally come and spurn the young men on with cheering as well.

column2: Forts with a command post increase the size of local garrison, troop morale and provide a seat for one additional commander.
A ditch is an obstacle, designed to slow down or break up an attacking force. Upgrading the ditch will increase the fort level.
Archer Tower provides a higher ground for archers defending a fortification. With further upgrades, number of archers and their strength is increased.
A large pillar or tree holy to Germanic and Norse pagans, also known as Thor's Oak and believed to represent the World Tree.
This set of simple dirt roads has a few signs to help indicate where travelers and traders should go.

column2: This is a small but vibrant trading post.
This trading post's prosperity has allowed it to grow into a large town, offering more protection against raiders and brigands and thus attracting more merchants who prefer to stay here and trade.

This is a major trading hub, where merchants come from all directions to trade their wares. All goods and services known to civilized man can be found here, and a myriad of languages echo through the many streets and alleys.
This toll booth is very small, meagerly manned and the guards not very well trained in the manner of collecting tolls.

column2: This building collects duties from passing traders

The majestic Cathedral of Aachen proudly looks over its city. It is a sign of powerful realm ruled by even more powerful ruler.
These ancient reminders of long lost civilization bring many wonderers here.
This rock-cut city was abandoned after an earthquake struck it many centuries ago, but it can still teach us many things about architecture.
Massive walls that protect the city against any foes.
Former northern border of the mighty Roman Empire that can still be used against enemies.
This walled city serves as a showcase of power and influence, aswell as a wealth of a strong realm.
Physicians will examine all incoming travelers and if needed isolate them before letting them into the city.
All incoming ships will be isolated for some time before being allowed to dock.
